results.title: The Chase
results.creator_credit: Shaun Elstob, Anutaro Tantraporn, John Sharpe, Gillian Morisson and Sharon Parker
results.brief_description: A man snatches a baby off its mother as she leaves a train station. Distraught, she pursues and then attacks him. But how maternal are her instincts to protect her ‘bundle of joy’?

results.title: Astrozoology 101
results.brief_description: An animation using the cutout techniques pioneered by Lotte Reiniger that revises the fairytale ‘The Frog Prince’. In this version the princess is a devouring alien.

results.title: Apoidea
results.brief_description: Computer animation about the evolution of a lily-like plant species on a watery planet. When the plants burst into bloom a swarm of metallic insects move in to fertilise its flowers. A violent ballet between insect and plant ensues.

results.title: Shaun Tan's The Lost Thing: From book to film. The Interviews
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Richard Greenhalgh, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Set in a city overrun by bureaucracy, Shaun Tan’s picture book ‘The Lost Thing’ tells the story of a boy who befriends a strange creature that doesn’t appear to fit in any of the available pigeon holes.
Melbourne-based production company Passion Pictures Australia invited Shaun to direct an animated version of ‘The Lost Thing’, and several years later, the Oscar®-winning short film emerged.
The ACMI exhibition ‘Shaun Tan’s The Lost Thing: From book to film’(showing in Gallery Two from 16th July 2013 to 19th January 2014), features Shaun’s exquisite original drawings and working sketches alongside exclusive footage of the animators and sound artists, demonstrating how the drawings were brought to life on screen with movement, sound effects, music and narration.
These eight interview segments are each based on a particular production process in the making of ‘The Lost Thing’.
The eight segments feature interviews with Shaun Tan (writer/co director), Sophie Byrne (producer), Tom Bryant (3D artist), Leo Baker (animator), John Kassab (sound designer) and Michael Yezerski (composer).
In addition to the interviews, there is a wealth of ‘behind-the-scenes’ footage, rough drafts of designs and animation wireframes from the very early stages of production.
results.title_for_label: Shaun Tan’s The Lost Thing: From book to film. The Interviews
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Richard Greenhalgh, Kim Montgomery and ACMI

group_works.title: The Chronicles of Narnia [DVD]
group_works.creator_credit: Marilyn Fox, Alex Kirby, Paul Stone and BBC-TV

results.title: The Chronicles of Narnia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Marilyn Fox, Alex Kirby, Paul Stone and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Chronicles of Narnia”.
A breathtaking live action, made for television rendition of C. S. Lewis’ powerful fantasy for all ages using stunning special effects to recreate the most exciting and enchanting adventure of them all. “The Lion, the witch and the wardrobe”: four children, sent from London into the countryside during the dangerous period of WW2, discover the magical world of Narnia - where dwarves, nymphs and giants reside, fauns carry umbrellas, animals talk and horses fly. It is also the land of Aslan, the great lion who can warm the coldest heart and his arch-enemy, the White Witch. “Prince Caspian”: Troubled times have come to Narnia and the evil King Miraz and his scheming Queen Prunaprismia have brought misery and an army of destruction to the peaceful land. Young Prince Caspian, rightful heir to the throne vows to save his kingdom and calls upon the aid of Peter, Susan, Edmund and Lucy. “The Voyage of the dawn treader”: A new quest begins for Edmund and Lucy, who, with their horrible cousin Eustace, join King Caspian on a voyage to find seven missing Lords of Narnia. The Silver chair Old King Caspian’s only son and heir, Prince Rillian has disappeared. The great lion, Aslan, calls on Jill and Eustace, guiding them in their search for the lost prince. On their perilous quest, the children meet up with Puddleglum who travels with them to the land of giants. Their search leads them to face the Green Witch, the Queen of the Deep Realm whose spell they must break. Each edition also available separately on VHS [301499], [301990], [302722].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marilyn Fox, Alex Kirby, Paul Stone and BBC-TV
